name: Rage
description: As a free action enter a rage for a number of rounds equal to 4 + Constitution modifier + 2 per barbarian level after first level. While raging gain +4 morale bonus to Strength and Constitution (granting 2 hit points per Hit Dice which disappear without being lost at the end of the rage), +2 morale bonus to Will saves, and a -2 penalty to AC. While raging cannot use Charisma, Dexterity, or Intelligence based skills except Acrobatics, Fly, Indimidate, and Ride. Rage can be ended as a free action. After a rage ends the barbarian is fatigued for a number of rounds equal to 2 times the number of rounds spent in a rage. Rage ends immediately upon going unconscious.

name: Bardic Performance
description: Use the perform skill to create magical effects on those around you, and yourself if desired. Can be used for a number of rounds per day equal to 4 + your Charisma modifier, and for each level after first you may perform for an additional 2 rounds per day. Starting a bardic performance is a standard action and maintaining a performance is a free action.

name: Channel Energy
description: Channel power through a holy (or unholy) symbol to release a wave of energy. Good clerics channel positive energy which heals all living creatures and damages all undead creatures within 30 feet. Evil clerics channel negative energy which heals undead creatures and damages living creatures. Neutral clerics must permanently choose at first level whether they will channel positive or negative energy. The magnitude of this effect is 1d6 points of damage plus 1d6 for every two cleric levels beyond the first. A Will save of 10 + 1/2 your cleric level + your Charisma modifier can be made to halve the damage dealt by channeled energy. May be used a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier., depending on good/evil alignment. Affects all creatures within a 30 foot radius; the magnitude of the effect is Nd6, where N is (cleric level + 1)/2, rounded down.

name: Flurry of Blows
description: Make a flurry of blows as a full attack action: the monk may make one additional attack with a -2 penalty on all attack roles, or two additional attacks at 8th level or above, or three additional attacks at 15th level and above.

name: Unarmed Strike
description: Monk gains Improved Unarmed Strike feat. Attacks may be with fist, elbows, knees, and feet.

name: Stunning Fist
description: Monk gains the Stunning Fist feat. Monk may replace the stun effect with the following effects at the following levels: fatigued at 4th level, sickened at 8th level, staggered at 12th level, permanently blind at 16th level, paralyzed at 20th level.

name: Ki Strike
description: Monk can spend one ki point to make a ki strike: at 4th level unarmed attacks are treated as magic weapons, at 7th level unarmed attacks are also treated as cold iron and silver, at 10th level unarmed attacks are also treated as lawful weaons, at 16th level unarmed attacks are also treated as adamantine weapons.

name: Wholeness of Body
description: Monk can spend two ki points to heal themselves a number of hitpoints equal to half their monk level as a standard action.

name: Abundant Step
description: Monk can spend two ki points to slip magically between spaces as if using the spell Dimension Door.

name: Quivering Palm
description: Once per day the monk can cause fatal vibrations in another creature. The monk must announce their intent before the attack, and if the attack deals damage then the attempt is successful, after which the monk can choose to kill the creature at any time using a free action. Can not affect creatures immune to critical hits.

name: Empty Body
description: The monk can spend three ki points to assume an ethereal state for 1 minute as if using the spell Etherealness.

name: Detect Evil
description: At will the paladin can use Detect Evil as the spell.

name: Smite Evil
description: As a swift action, once per day (and an additonal time per day per three levels after first level) the paladin may smite an enemy. If that enemy is evil, the paladin ads their Charisma bonus to attack rolls and adds their paladin level to all damage rolls made against the target. If the target is an outsider, dragon, or undead the damage bonus increases to 2 points per paladin level for the first successful attack. The paladin gains a deflection bonus equal to their Charisma modifier against attacks made by the target of the smite.

name: Lay on Hands
description: The paladin can heal wounds by touch. As a standard action on others or a swift action on self heal 1d6 per 2 paladin levels, or deal that much damage as a melee touch attack to an undead target. May be used a number of times per day equal to 1/2 of the caster's paladin level plus their Charisma modifier.

name: Channel Positive Energy
description: At the cost of two uses of Lay on Hands the paladin may channel positive energy like a cleric. This is a Charisma based ability.

name: Aura of Justice
description: At the cost of two uses of Smite Evil the paladin may grant the ability to Smite Evil to all allies within 10 feet. Allies must use this smite before the start of the paladin's next turn and the bonuses last for 1 minute. Evil allies gain no benefit from this ability.

name: Endurance
description: Gain Endurance as a bonus feat

name: Quarry
description: As a standard action you may denote one target in line of sight as your quarry. You may take 10 on Survival checks when following your quarry at normal speed, and you receive a +2 insight bonus on attack rolls against your quarry, and all critical threats are automatically confirmed. You may have only one quarry at a time and your quarry must correspond to one of your favored enemy types. You may dismiss this effect as a free action, but may not designate a new quarry within 24 hours. If you see proof that your quarry is dead you may select a new quarry after 1 hour.

name: Improved Quarry
description: You may now select a quarry as a free action and can take a 20 while using Survival to track your quarry. Your insight bonus increases to +4. If your quarry is killed or dismissed, you may select a new quarry after 10 minutes.

name: Sneak Attack
description: Any time your target would be denied a Dexterity bonus to AC you may strike a vital spot for extra damage. Extra damage is 1d6 at first level and an additional 1d6 ever two rogue levels after first, extra damage is not affected by critical multipliers. You may choose to deal lethal or non-lethal damaage when using a weapon which deals non-lethal damage, but weapons which deal lethal damage always deal lethal bonus damage.

You may use this ability once per day, increasing to twice per day at 17th level.

name: Within Reach (su)

name: Destiny Realized (su)
description: Any critical threats made against you only confirm if the second roll results in a natural 20. Any critical threats you score with a spell are automatically confirmed. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier.

name: Death's Gift (su)
description: You gain resist cold 5 and DR 5/- against nonlethal damage. At 9th level this increases to resist cold 10 and DR 10/- against nonlethal damage.

name: Grasp of the Dead (sp)
description: You can cause a swarm of skeletal arms to brust from the ground to rip and tear at your foes. The skeletal arms erupt from the ground in a 20-foot-radius burst. Anyone in this area takes 1d6 points of slashing damage per Sorcerer level. Those caught in the area receive a Reflex save for half damage. Those who fail the save are unable to move for 1 round. The DC for this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 your Sorcerer level + your Charisma modifier. The skeletal arms disappear after 1 round. The arms must burst up from a solid surface. You can use this ability once per day at 9th level, twice per day at 17th level, and three times per day at 20th level. This power has a range of 60 feet.

name: Incorporeal Form (sp)
description: Once per day you can become incorporeal for 1 round per Sorcerer level. While in this form, you gain the incorporeal subtype. You only take half damage from corporeal sources as long as they are magic (you take no damage from non-magic weapons and objects). Likewise, your spells deal only half damage to corporeal creatures. Spells and other effects that do not deal damage function normally.

name: One of Us (ex)
description: Your form begins to rot (the appearance is up to you) and undead see you as one of them. You gain immunity to cold, nonlethal damage, paralysis, and sleep. You also gain DR 5/-. Unintelligent undead do not notice you unless you attack them. You receive a +4 morale bonus on saving throws made against spells and spell-like abilities cast by undead.

name: Scribe Scroll

name: Resistance (ex)
description: You gain resistance 5 to an energy type of your choice, chosen when you prepare your spells each day. Increases to resistance 10 at 11th level, and becomes immunity at 20th level.

name: Protective Ward (sp)
description: As a standard action create a 10-foot-radius field of protective magic centered on you that lasts for a number of rounds equal to your Intelligence modifier. All allies in this area (including you) receive a +1 deflection bonus to their AC, increasing by +1 for every five wizard levels you possess. You may use thiss ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Intelligence modifier.

name: Energy Absorption (su)
description: You have an amount of energy absorption equal to 3 times your wizard level per day. Whenever you take energy damage, apply immunity, vulnerability, and resistance first and apply the remainder to this absorption, reducing your daily total by that amount. Any damage in excess of your absorption is applied to you normally.

name: Summoner's Charm (su)
description: Whenever you case a Conjuration spell increase teh durration by a number of rounds equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum 1). This is not doubled by Extend Spell. At 20th level, you can change the duration of all summon monster spells to be permanent, but can have no more than one summon spell permanent at a time.

name: Acid Dart (sp)
description: As a standard action you can unleash an acid dart targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged touch attack. This deals 1d6 points of acid damage +1 for every two wizard levels you possess. You may use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Intelligence modifier. This attack ignores spell resistance.

name: Dimensional Steps (sp)
description: You may teleport up to 30 feet per wizard level per day as a standard action. This musts be used in 5-foot increments and does not provoke an attack of opportunity. You may bring other willing creatures with you, but must expend an equal amount of distance for each additional creature.

name: Forewarned (su)
description: You can always act in a surprise round even if you fail to make a Perception roll to notice a foe, but you are still considered flat-footed until you take an action. You also receive a bonus on initiative checks equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum +1). At 20th level you may assume a natural 20 on all initiative rolls.

name: Diviner's Fortune (sp)
description: You may touch any creature as a standard action to give it an insight bonus on all of its attack rolls, skill checks, and saving throws equal to 1/2 your Wizard level (minimum +1) for 1 round. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Intelligence modifier.

name: Scrying Adept (sp)
description: You are always aware when you are being observed via magic. In addition, whenever you scry on a subject, treat the subject as one step more familiar to you. Very familiar subjects gget a -10 penalty on their save to avoid your scrying attempts.

name: Enchanting Smile (su)
description: You gain a +2 enhancement bonus on Bluff, Diplomacy, and Intimidate skill checks, increasing by an additional +1 for every five Wizard levels you possess. At 20th level, whenever you succeed at a savingg throww against a spell of the enchantment school, that spell is reflected back at its caster, as per spell turning.

name: Dazing Touch (sp)
description: You can cause a living creature to become dazed for 1 round as a melee touch attack. Creatures with more Hit Dice than your wizard level are unaffected.You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3+ your Intelligence modifier.

name: Aura of Despair (su)
description: You can emit a 30-foot aura of despaiir for a number of rounds per day equal to your wizard level. Enemies within this aura take a -2 penalty on ability checks, attack rolls, damage rolls, savingg throws, and skill checks. These rounds do not need to be consecutive. This is a mind-altering affect.

name: Intense Spells (su)
description: Whenever you cast an evocation spell that deals damage, add 1/2 your wizard level to the damage (minimum +1). This bonus damage is not increased by Empower Spell or similar effects. This only applies once per spell, not once per missile or ray, and cannot be split between multiple missiles or rays. This damage is of the same type as the spell. At 20th level, whenever you cast an evocation spell you can roll twice to penetrate a creature's spell resistance and take the better result.

name: Force Missile (sp)
description: As a standard action you can unleash a force missile that automattically strikes a foe, as magic missile. The force missile deals 1d4 points of damage plus the damage from your intense spells evocation power. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3+ your Intelligence modifier.

name: Elemental Wall (sp)
description: You can create a wall of energy that lasts for a number of rounds per day equal to your wizard level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive. This wall deals acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage, determined when you create it. The elemental wall otherwise functions like wall of fire.

name: Extended Illusions (su)
description: Any illusion spell you cast with a duration of 'concentration' lasts a number of additional rounds equal to 1/2 your wizard level after you stop maintaining concentration (minimum +1 round). At 20th level, you can make one illusion spell with a duration of 'concentration' become permanent. Only one spell can be permanent at a time.

name: Blinding Ray (sp)
description: As a standard action you can fire a shimmering ray at any foe within 30 feet as a ranged touch attack. The ray causes creatures to be blinded for 1 round. Creatures with more Hit Dice than your Wizard level are dazzled for 1 round instead. You can use this ability a number of times equal to 3+ your Intelligence modifier.

name: Invisibility Field (sp)
description: You can make yourself invisible as a swift action for a number of rounds equal to your wizard level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive. Otherise functions as greater invisiblity.

name: Power over Undead (su)
description: Take Command Undead or Turn Undead as a bonus feat. You can channel energy a number of times per day equal to 3+ your Intelligence modifier, but only to use this bonus feat. You may take other feats to add to this ability, like Extra Channel or Improved Channel, but not feats that alter this ability. For the DC of these saves, use your wizard level instead of your cleric level. At 20th level, undead cannot add their channel resist to the save against this ability.

name: Grave Touch (sp)
description: As a standard action, you can make a melee touch attack that causes a living creature to become shaken for a number of rounds equal to 1/2 your wizard level (minimum 1). If you touch a shaken creature they become frightened for 1 round, if they have fewer Hit Dice than your wizard level. You can use this ability a number of times equal to 3 + your Intelligence modifier.

name: Life Sight (su)
description: You gain blindsight to a range of 10 feet for a number of rounds per day equal to your wizard level. This ability only allows you to detect living creatures and undead creatures. This sight also tells whether a creature is living or undead. The range increases by 10 feet at 12th level, and an additional 10 feet for every four levels beyond 12th. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.

name: Physical Enhancement (su)
description: You gain a +1 enhancement bonus to one phisical ability score (Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution). This bonus increases by +1 for every five wizard levels you possess to a maximum as +5 at 20th level. You can change this bonus to a new ability score when you prepare spells. At 20th level this applies to two physical ability scores at a time.

name: Telekinetic Fist (sp)
description: As a standard action you can strike with a telekinetic fist, targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged touch attack. The telekinetic fist deals 1d4 points of bludgeoning damage + 1 for every two wizard levels you possess. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Intelligence modifier.

name: Change Shape (sp)
description: You can change your shape for a number of rounds per day equal to your wizard level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive. This ability otherwise functions like Beast Shape II or Elemental Body I. At 12th level, this ability functions like Beast Shape III or Elemental Body II.

name: Hand of the Apprentice (su)
description: You cause your melee weapon to fly from your grasp and strike a foe before instantly returning to you. As a standard action, you can make a single attack using a melee weapon at a range of 30 feet. This attack is treated as a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, except that you add your Intelligence modifier on the attack roll instead of your Dexterity modifier (damage still relies on Strength). This ability cannot be used to perform a combat maneuver. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Intelligence modifier.

name: Metamagic Mastery (su)
description: You can apply any one metamagic feat that you know to a spell you are about to cast. This does not alter the level of the spell or the casting time. You can use this ability once per day at 8th level, and one additional time per day for every two wizard levels you possess beyond 8th. Any time you use this ability to apply a metamagic feat that increases the spell level by more than 1, you must use an additional daily usage for each level above 1 that the feat adds to the spell. Even though this ability does not modify the spell's actual level, you cannot use this ability to cast a spell whose modified spell level would be above the level of the highest-level spell that you are capable of casting.

name: Storm Burst (sp)
description: As a standard action, you can create a storm burst targeting any foe within 30 feet as a ranged touch attack. The storm burst deals 1d6 points of nonlethal damage + 1 point for every two cleric levels you possess. In addition, the target is buffeted by winds and rain, causing it to take a -2 penalty on attack rolls for 1 round. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Wisdom modifier.

name: Lightning Lord (sp)
description: You can call down a number of bolts of lightning per day to your cleric level. You can call down as many bolts as you want with a single standard action, but no creature can be the target of more than one bolt and no two targets can be more than 30 feet apart. This ability otherwise functions as the Call Lightning spell.

name: Bardic Performance: Countersong (su)
description: You can use your performance to counter magic effects that depend on sound (but not spells that have verbal components). Each round of the countersong you must make a Perform (keyboard, percussion, wind, string, or sing) skill check. Any creature within 30 feet of the bard (including the bard) that is affected by a sonic or language-dependent magical attack may use the Bard's Perform check result in place of their own saving throw if, after the saving throw is rolled, the Perform check result is higher.If a creature within range of the countersong is already under the effect of a noninstantaneous sonic or language-dependent magical attack, they gain another saving throw against the effect each round it hears the countersong, but they must use the Bard's Perform check result for the save. This does not work on effects that don't allow saves. Relies on audible components.

name: Bardic Performance: Distraction (su)
description: You can use your performance to counter magic effects that depend on sight. Each round of the distraction you must make a Perform (act, comedy, dance, or oratory) skill check. Any creature within 30 feet of the bard (including the bard) that is affected by a illusion (pattern) or illusion (figment) magical attack may use the Bard's Perform check result in place of their own saving throw if, after the saving throw is rolled, the Perform check result is higher.If a creature within range of the distraction is already under the effect of a noninstantaneous illusion (pattern) or illusion (figment) magical attack, they gain another saving throw against the effect each round it sees the distraction, but they must use the Bard's Perform check result for the save. This does not work on effects that don't allow saves. Relies on visual components.

name: Bardic Performance: Fascinate (su)
description: You can use your performance to cause one or more creatures to become fascinated with you. Each creature to be fascinated must be within 90 feet, able to see and hear you, and capable of paying attention to you. You must also be able to see the creatures affected. The Distraction of a nearby combat or other dangers prevents the ability from working. For every three levels you have attained beyond 1st, you can target one additional creature with this ability. Each creature within range receives a Will save (DC 10 + 1/2 your bard level + your Cha modifier) to negate the effect. If a creature's saving throw succeeds, you cannot attempt to fascinate that creature again for 24 hours. If its saving throw fails, the creature sits quietly and observes the performance for as long as you continues to maintain it. While fascinated, a target takes a -4 penalty on skill checks made as reactions, such as Perception checks. Any potential threat to the target allows the target to make a new saving throw against the effect. Any obvious threat, such as someone drawing a weapon, casting a spell, or aiming a weapon at the target, automatically breaks the effect. Fascinate is an enchantment (compulsion), mind-affecting ability. Relies on audible and visual components.

name: Bardic Performance: Inspire Courage (su)
description: You can use your performance to inspire courage in your allies (including yourself), bolstering them against fear and improving their combat abilities. To be affected, an ally must be able to perceive your performance. An affected ally receives a +1 morale bonus on saving throws against charm and fear effects and a +1 competence bonus on attack and weapon damage rolls. At 5th level, and every six bard levels thereafter, this bonus increases by +1, to a maximum of +4 at 17th level. Inspire courage is a mind-affecting ability. Inspire courage can use audible or visual components, You must choose which component to use when starting his performance.

name: Bardic Performance: Inspire Competence (su)
description: You can use your performance to help an ally succeed at a task. The ally must be within 30 feet and able to see and hear you. The ally gets a +2 competence bonus on skill checks with a particular skill as long as they continue to hear the performance. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels you have attained beyond 3rd (+3 at 7th, +4 at 11th, +5 at 15th, and +6 at 19th). Certain uses of this ability are infeasible, such as Stealth, and may be disallowed at the GM's discretion. You can't inspire competence in yourself. Relies on audible components.

name: Bardic Performance: Suggestion (su)
description: You can use your performance to make a suggestion (as per the spell) to a creature that you have already fascinated (see above). Using this ability does not disrupt the fascinate effect, but it does require a standard action to activate (in addition to the free action to continue the fascinate effect). You can use this ability more than once against an individual creature during an individual performance. A Will saving throw (DC 10 + 1/2 your bard level + your Cha modifier) negates the effect. This ability affects only a single creature (but see mass suggestion, below). Suggestion is an enchantment (compulsion), mind-affecting, language-dependent ability and relies on audible components.

name: Bardic Performance: Dirge of Doom (su)
description: You can use your performance to foster a sense of growing dread in your enemies, causing them to take become shaken. To be affected, an enemy must be within 30 feet and able to see and hear your performance. The effect persists for as long as the enemy is within 30 feet and you continue the performance. The performance cannot cause a creature to become frightened or panicked, even if the targets are already shaken from another effect. Dirge of doom is a mind-affecting fear effect, and it relies on audible and visual components.

name: Bardic Performance: Inspire Greatness (su)
description: You can use your performance to inspire greatness in yourself or a single willing ally within 30 feet, granting extra fighting capability. For every three levels you attain beyond 9th, you can target one additional ally while using this performance (up to a maximum of four at 18th level). To inspire greatness, all of the targets must be able to see and hear you. A creature inspired with greatness gains 2 bonus Hit Dice (d10s), the commensurate number of temporary hit points (apply the target's Constitution modifier, if any, to these bonus Hit Dice), a +2 competence bonus on attack rolls, and a +1 competence bonus on Fortitude saves. The bonus Hit Dice count as regular Hit Dice for determining the effect of spells that are Hit Dice dependent. Inspire greatness is a mind-affecting ability and it relies on audible and visual components.

name: Bardic Performance: Soothing Performance (su)
description: You can use your performance to create an effect equivalent to the mass cure serious wounds, using your bard level as the caster level. In addition, this performance removes the fatigued, sickened, and shaken condition from all those affected. Using this ability requires 4 rounds of continuous performance, and the targets must be able to see and hear you throughout the performance. Soothing performance relies on audible and visual components.

name: Bardic Performance: Frightening Tune (su)
description: You can use your performance to cause fear in his enemies. To be affected, an enemy must be able to hear you perform and be within 30 feet. Each enemy within range receives a Will save (DC 10 + 1/2 your bard level + your Cha modifier) to negate the effect. If the save succeeds, the creature is immune to this ability for 24 hours. If the save fails, the target becomes frightened and flees for as long as the target can hear your performance. Frightening tune relies on audible components.

name: Bardic Performance: Inspire Heroics (su)
description: You can use your performance to inspire tremendous heroism in yourself or a single ally within 30 feet. For every three bard levels you attain beyond 15th, you can inspire heroics in one additional creature. To inspire heroics, all of the targets must be able to see and hear you. Inspired creatures gain a +4 morale bonus on saving throws and a +4 dodge bonus to AC. The effect lasts for as long as the targets are able to witness the performance. Inspire heroics is a mind-affecting ability that relies on audible and visual components.

name: Bardic Performance: Mass Suggestion (su)
description: This ability functions just like Bardic Performance: Suggestion, but allows you to make a suggestion simultaneously to any number of creatures that you have already fascinated. Mass suggestion is an enchantment (compulsion), mind-affecting, language dependent ability that relies on audible components.

name: Bardic Performance: Deadly Performance (su)
description: You can use your performance to cause one enemy to die from joy or sorrow. To be affected, the target must be able to see and hear you perform for 1 full round and be within 30 feet. The target receives a Will save (DC 10 + 1/2 your bard level + your Cha modifier) to negate the effect. If a creature's saving throw succeeds, the target is staggered for 1d4 rounds, and you cannot use deadly performance on that creature again for 24 hours. If a creature's saving throw fails, it dies. Deadly performance is a mind-effecting death effect that relies on audible and visual components.
